subject: Re: Re: [junit] Eclipse JUnit bug?
msgSnippet: Hello there, It is always better not to pass parameters in junit test cases. Kindly respond to this concept. Regards, Rajeev ... [Non-text portions of this
messageBody:
Hello there,

It is always better not to pass parameters in junit test cases.
Kindly respond to this concept.

Regards,
Rajeev

On Wed, 03 Nov 2004 JB.Rainsberger wrote :
>Rod Gonzaga wrote:
>>
>> Anyone have the following bizarre problem in Eclipse w/Junit?
>>
>> Have some test cases, all with the proper public constructors that take
>> one string as a parameter. When I try to run them using the JUnit plug-in,
>> I get the AssertionFailedError 'cuz it can't find the the constructors.
>>
>> When I manually invoke java.textui.TestRunner on the tests, they work fine.
>>
>> I'm in Eclipse 3.0.1  JUnit 3.8.1
>Please show us the source for one of those TestCase classes. Thanks.
>--
>J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
